mixed-citation.article-title: Systematic revision of the pantropical whip spider family Charinidae Quintero, 1986 (Arachnida, Amblypygi)

tp:treatment-sec.p:
This species may be separated from other Caribbean and Central American
Charinus
by means of the following combination of characters: anterior area of carapace broadly convex, slightly narrower in males; median eyes absent ( Fig. 21A, C ); median ocular tubercle small; lateral eyes well developed ( Fig. 21A ); tritosternum bottle-shaped, extremely short (wider than long) ( Fig. 21B ); cheliceral claw with eight teeth; pedipalp tarsus with two dorsal curved spines, distal spine half length of the tarsus, proximal spine half length of distal spine; tibia of leg I with 21 articles, tarsus I with 33 articles; leg IV basitibia with three pseudo-article; leg IV basitibia trichobothrium bc situated equidistant between bf and sbf ; leg IV distitibia sc and sf series each with five trichobothria.
